meanings.definition: A leader or savior expected to bring about a new era of peace and happiness.
meanings.sent1: The messiah of the story arrived just in time to save the kingdom from darkness.
meanings.sent2: The community believed the messiah would lead them to a better future.
meanings.sent3: When the messiah tripped over a rock, everyone laughed at the unexpected clumsiness.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness and wisdom made her the messiah of the office, guiding colleagues through challenges.
meanings.sent5: The messiah's arrival was like a burst of sunlight after a long storm, bringing hope to all.

meanings.definition: A person regarded as or claiming to be a savior or liberator.
meanings.sent1: The self-proclaimed messiah preached about love and forgiveness to the crowd.
meanings.sent2: In the ancient tale, the false messiah led his followers astray with deceitful promises.
meanings.sent3: The messiah of the internet claimed to have the ultimate solution to all tech problems.
meanings.sent4: She jokingly referred to her cat as the household messiah, always bringing joy with its antics.
meanings.sent5: The charismatic speaker presented himself as the messiah of success, promising wealth to his listeners.
